headline: Baked Ziti IV
description: Ziti pasta is layered with Provolone, mozzarella, cottage cheese, sour cream and a meaty sauce with ground beef and sausage.

video.description: Here's a quick and easy baked ziti recipe, perfect for a weeknight dinner.
video.name: Baked Ziti IV

name: Baked Ziti IV

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook onion in oil until tender. Stir in rosemary and garlic. Transfer to a small bowl.

Place ground beef and sausage in the skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Stir in the onion mixture and the spaghetti sauce. Season with salt. Reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In the prepared dish, layer 1/2 of the cooked pasta, provolone cheese, sour cream, cottage cheese, and a little less than 1/2 of the meat mixture. Then layer the rest of the pasta, mozzarella cheese, remaining meat mixture, and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until heated through and cheeses are melted.

review.reviewBody: Made it per the recommendation of others, mixing the pasta into the meat mixture, mixing the cheeses together, doing the layering, then placing the provolone on top. Worked very well.
I've made this and it's wonderful!
Easy to make. Leftovers for lunch!
Good stuff. I added mushrooms and spinach. Delicious
Loved it. Will be a staple.

This recipe is definitely a keeper with a few changes that I made. I used one and a half 28 oz. jars of Rao's Marinara Sauce. As some others suggested, I mixed the meat sauce and noodles together. I used a 15-16oz. tub of ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese and mixed that with the sour cream, mozzarella and parmesan cheese. I then layered half the meat/noodle mixture on the bottom of a 13x9" pan, spread the cheese/sour cream mixture on top, layered the rest of the meat/noodle mixture and then topped with the provolone cheese. I baked it covered for about 30 minutes and then uncovered it for about 5-10 minutes. Everyone LOVED it! I served it with a green salad and garlic bread. Next time I might add some fresh italian parsley to the cheese mixture.
Made it pretty much as written and it came out amazing! I have even recommended it to family.
This is by far the best baked ziti recipe I’ve tried. It had lots of flavor and a gourmet touch to it. I am very impressed and definitely doing it again.
Simply the best!! This has been added to my favourites! Since I didn’t have Rosemary, I added a sprinkling of Italian Seasoning. I also used my homemade tomato sauce.
Delicious! Family all loved it.
I like this recipe, I used Italian seasoning instead of rosemary. Turned out well
Very easy to make. I made two changes. One adding basil to the onion garlic rosemary mixture. Also I can’t stand cottage cheese so I used ricotta instead.

I've made this a few times and it's a good recipe. I always add basil as well. The only other change I strongly recommend is that you put the provolone in two different layers and spread it out more, don't cram it all together. Provolone is potent and If you don't spread it out it can be way too concentrated and overpowering in some bites. I put half of the provolone on the first layer, and had it more spread out and then put the rest of it on the second layer below the remaining sauce, that way you can taste it but you don't get anymore bites that sting your tastebuds lol.

(Yes I used the proper baking dish and quantity of cheese)
Canned sauce of any kind is a culinary sin. Make your own sauce people! Other than that, a good recipe.

Great recipe for an amazing comfort food! My family loved it so much! The only thing I would add is more cheese!! If you want it to be cheesy and stringy I would suggest adding lots more provologne and mozarella! But by itself it is still a very yummy recipe!

Made exactly according to directions except I did toss my pasta with a bit of the meat sauce before adding each layer to ensure a moist dinner. It was very moist, cheesy, tasty and was enjoyed by all! Great presentation and overall flavor! As it makes a lot, I made a large casserole for my family and two smaller ones for elderly neighbors. We all throughly enjoyed! Thanks much for the post!

I have made this several times. Always a crowd pleaser. I have used suggestions from several of the reviewers - added red peppers to the meat mixture, seasoned with italian and basil seasonings, used ricotta instead of cottage cheese. All delicious. This last time, I substituted ground deer meat for the hamburger. Thanks for the recipe.
Made this for a friend when they left the hospital. Their family loved it. Stated it was a wonderful comfort food.

So good! I did use ricotta instead of cottage cheese. Neither the hubs or I eat cottage cheese. Other than that, followed the recipe. I’ve never made ziti this way, and I was skeptical. But, wow, it was good! It does make a lot. It’s just the two of us empty nesters here. Enough for a family of four or five, or enough to share with a neighbor if you like yours. Hubs is on plate #2 so you know it’s pretty darn good. He can be a picky eater! I wish I had taken a picture when it came out of the oven, it was pretty, but we were hungry! I will definitely be making this again.
Followed the recipe best as I could with what I had....I used whole wheat penne, hot Italian sausage and homemade sauce. The BF loved it!
Didn’t use sausage but very very good
Made it and the family loves it
Family loved to. I did add some ricotta cheese to cottage cheese mixture
This is great! I substituted ricotta cheese for the cottage cheese. I used one jar of prego sauce and added 1/4 cup of crushed tomatoes. This was excellent. Perfect quarantine comfort food!

this recipe tastes too good for being this simple to make. due to the quarantine I had to use large elbow macaroni instead of ziti, grated mozzarella in place of the provolone, and substituted dried rosemary for fresh since that's what I had on hand. and tbh, I don't think it could have made that much of a difference (when using dried herbs, always crush them between your fingers a bit before adding them in to release more flavor). but other than those minor changes I stayed true to the recipe. don't skip on the sour cream or substitute ricotta for the cottage cheese either. it just won't be as creamy. even if you don't like cottage cheese, trust me. you'll love it in this. and every other time I've made baked ziti the recipe called for mixing the pasta with sauce, the cheese mixture, or both. this recipe didn't call for that so I left it dry. IT WAS SO GOOD. and probably why it was very close to a lasagna (but half the work). if I could give this recipe more than five stars I would. I took a few photos but I'm having problems loading them right now. I will come back and try to post them again later.

I've made this twice and love it! it was a huge hit with everyone I've made it for as well. I describe it as a deconstructed lasagna, and it takes much less effort! I did make some changes, some for my own preference, some from the suggestions of other reviewers.
1. I used ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese.
2. I used 1/4 package (80 grams total) of shredded old cheddar and 1/4 package (80 grams total) of shredded Italian blend cheese instead if the provolone.
3. I added 1 tablespoon of Italian seasoning.
4. I added 1 teaspoon of dried basil.
5. I sprinkled shredded parmesan as well as grated on top to my desire without measuring.
6. I added 1 medium red pepper, diced, and cooked with onion.
7. I mixed all the cheese (aside from parm) together in a bowl.
8. I took the advice to put a small amount of sauce on the bottom of sprayed baking dish, then layered noodles, cheese mixture, meat sauce and repeated.
My family loves this recipe. We are meat lovers so I usually double the meat. Great comfort food!
This recipe is awesome and the flavor of the ziti was excellent.

Fantastic! I made this exactly as written (well except I didn't measure the cheese I topped it with at the end - just covered the top w/ the shredded cheeses). I made 2 of them, actually - 1 to freeze & 1 to cook the next day :) LOVE
It was a big hit! Made one with the meat and one without! Both were equally good!
Followed the recipe but added a covering for the first 25 minutes and then took it off for the last 5 minutes. Thought it could have cooked a little longer but it may have been my oven.

I used 1 pound ground beef and 1/2 pound ground pork. This produced a moist meatloaf (but a little more fat to skim off). I substituted 1 cup of Italian seasoned bread crumbs for the bread slices and used sea salt. The two teaspoons of salt specified in the recipe made the meatloaf way too salty. I'll use one teaspoon next time. Overall, it was moist and nicely seasoned. Wrong recipe. Sorry!
Staple recipe. Can vary it easily with what you have in hand. Love the cottage cheese - not as heavy as ricotta. Have made it several times.

I cut the receipt in half to serve 6. Turned out pretty good except that the cooking time needs to be longer. 30 minutes was not enough time for the flavors to meld. It was better the next day when I heated up the leftovers. I would not use cottage cheese again. Think that ricotta will be better.
This turned out wonderfully. The sour cream had me nervous but it worked. The only change I made was to use ricotta cheese because that’s what I had.
You’ve out done yourself this time!!! So says my wife..
Loved it. My only add was a can of Hot Rotel because I like a little heat. I’ll be making this again.
This was really excellent! I made my own sauce and it was seriously just amazing! Could not recommend this any more than I am now!
This is a favorite dish wherever I go, and has been requested.
Big hit using venison sausage and Classico sauce... I also put 1/3 of the recipe in a loaf pan to freeze... yum!
I've made this before and for some reason this time the sausage really did not agree with me. Maybe it was just the sausage I used but ...otherwise kids loved it.
Recipe was bland.
I made it and followed the recipe exactly! Absolutely delicious! 5 ??‘S!

This recipe didn't go over well with us. Not enough flavor and the mozzarella was stringy.
Prefer baked spaghetti.
Love this recipe. Used all ground beef, and added extra mozzarella instead of cottage cheese. This is a huge hit at a team pasta dinner and now it's my go to recipe!
My husband always orders baked ziti when we eat Italian. He said this was professional and his new fave!
Had our children and grandchildren over for supper. This was a BIG HIT! No leftovers, not even a crumb. Will definitely be making again.
This is one of the best ziti dishes I have ever had. Made a huge batch so plenty of leftovers.
Skipped the cottage cheese and it still tasted good
Turned out great. I added some sliced mushrooms and spinach that I needed to use up and my family loved it.
I added ricotta to the sour cream. Came out great!
Cooked this for the first time and it was great!!! I substituted the cottage cheese for ricotta cheese and it was pretty tasty
It tasted delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :-)
Loved it! Great taste

I liked it. The only thing I'd change is I'd remove the sour cream. It didn't actually melt and so there were chunks of sour cream (and I HATE sour cream). So it kinda made it gross for me. But I'd make it again without. 

OH! And I pre-made my own sauce. There's NO way I'd use jarred sauce
Thanx, for the great recipe, i just substituted with ricotta cheese and a ground beef meat sauce.
Really good, my whole family loves it! Will make again.
Firm favourite in our house

Excellent recipe. All the taste of lasagna but with less work. I took this dish to a party and everyone raved. I followed the recipe exactly except, since I was pressed for time, I left out the onion and used a chunky pasta sauce. Will definitely make again.
Delicious! Husband said too much cheese but I loved it!

SERVED AT MY DINNER PARTY OF 6 ADULTS , ONE CHILD AND "ZERO" WAS LEFT IN THE PAN. And a side note, one couple was delayed 30 min so we covered and held oven at 170 degrees, no one knew the difference. Will make again!
This recipe was really good but I would make one change next time... the rosemary was overwhelming. I may omit it all together or at least cut it down.

Made this for our ladies' game night. It was a huge hit. The only thing I changed was to use ricotta instead of the cottage cheese & to add a tsp of fresh ground oregano from my garden. It was very easy & was my first attempt at baked ziti. I prepared the meat sauce mixture the night before & heated again before adding to the dish.

We loved it! I did use Italian sausage as I misread the ingredient list and that's what I bought. Loved the fresh rosemary in it, just enough to taste it but not overpower dish. The instructions didn't state to drain meat after it's been cooked, but likely because it's a no-brainer. Liked this better than the other versions I've tried. I did end up using two jars of sauce.

I followed the recipe exactly without changes, and it's good but not a 5 star recipe for me. I would recommend changing pork sausage for Italian sausage and swap the cottage cheese for ricotta cheese. I understand the jarred sauce helps speed up the process, but the sauce is an area where some of the flavor comes from.
This was great! I increased each meat by 50%. It made a ton of servings and my coworkers have all been jealous of how good it smells at lunch!
Very good dish, very well received by my family.

I've been making this ziti for a few years now and it's become a family favorite. I substituted Ricotta for the cottage cheese and used my homemade sauce. I also add more fresh herbs to the meat while cooking, just a personal preference. The texture is very creamy with the sour cream. This is another winner!

This is so delicious. My friends request it regularly. I love that it freezes well and we can always just pop a square in the oven or microwave whenever we want it. The only things that I do differently is use smoked provolone versus the regular and add some italian spices to the cream mixture. We also do not eat beef so I use ground turkey as well as ground turkey sausage.

It was delicious! I used ground turkey and turkey sausage. I mixed sour cream, low fat cottage cheese, parm and mozzarella together for the middle layer. I also placed 7 slices of provolone on top and sprinkled with a little mozzarella. I placed in oven for 20 minutes. Thanks for recipe!

Wonderful core recipe! I mixed the sour cream and cottage cheese and added some pepper to the mixture. I also used brown rice/quinoa ziti pasta I found at my local supermarket. A bit healthier alternative without sacrificing flavor! Also, we had some fresh smoked sausage on hand, sliced it up, browned in a pan, and it was AMAZING! I'm sure it is also fabulous with the recommended recipe protein. Sweet and smoky ziti was the best comfort combo we could have asked for. We can't wait to make at our next gathering! Yummy! Thank you for sharing ??

This one is good stuff! Classical home baked comfort food. I didn't have any sausage, so we just used ground beef, and I used 2 lbs, cuz that's how I like my sauce. I used 2 full jars of sauce, since there was extra meat. The rest of the recipe I followed to a tee. 
Very few things I make in this house of 7 please all of us. This one DID!!
I’ve made this multiple times for the fam. The kids live it. It’s good just the way it is. :)

Yes,yes,yes! I will make this again and again. I did not add salt and this came out plenty salty. Maybe because I added some pepperoni rounds (quartered) and the cheeses. Only used sausage (a pound), and eyeballed everything else. Used Italian cheese blend and the provolone, and a pretty good dose of parm on top. Used one quart of sauce and 1/3 C pasta water. Added onion, garlic, and mushrooms; all fresh and put in w/ the sausage to cook. Hubs didn't say a word while eating, then asked for seconds! Makes alot, which we like, so we have leftovers, and some to freeze for down the road. Thanks for the great recipe!!!
I just added 1/2 teaspoon salt and made the wedges thinner but it was so delicious. I'm gonna make it again
Made it exactly as recipie called for. Was really good will make it again.
Made this exactly as written several times now. Definitely a keeper. We love it! Thank you!
Made it as is and everyone loved it. It has been requested again and again.
Really good!!!! Did everything the same but used lean turkey for the meat and added oregano and basil to the meat sauce. Definitely recommend for a dinner and it's great because it makes so much

Was a little wary about cottage cheese/sour cream provalone combo, but wow! Really good. Took advice of previous reviews and mixed sour cream, cottage cheese in a bowl beforehand to make an easy spread. Also added garlic powder, oregano to mix. Threw in some fresh basil on second layer, then some more to garnish. Looking forward to leftovers as I hear it gets better w age..
Love this simple recipe. Can adapt to whatever you have on hand. Also great make ahead recipe. Thanks!

I have made this several times for family, friends and coworkers. Everyone loves it. I usually use Ragu Sundried Tomato & Sweet Basil. I mix the cottage cheese and sour cream together with about 1/2 tsp of italian seasoning before layering.

thought it was good. used italian flavored ground turkey. Didn't have rosemary, so used italian seasoning. also used a box (only 12oz) of rotini. Used hunts meat flavored sauce 24 oz. plus 8 oz of tomato sauce. Caden liked.

This was great. No one would ever guess that the cottage cheese and sour cream was not ricotta. Only change I made was tossing the meat sauce and pasta together. First time I made it l didn't and not much sauce made it to the bottom layer.
Delicious, and a piece of cake to assemble. I'm a sucker for baked pasta dishes, so I was delighted with the way it came out, but more demanding palates may want a touch more seasoning.
I didn't add the cottage cheese just used sour cream. . Sooooo good whole family ate it for dinner 2 days in a row

I make this all the time and it's really quite tasty. I've made it as written and it's good, however over the years I've came up with my own recipe. First, I use high-protein pasta as not only is it healthier, it holds up better in baked pasta dishes I've found. I also use an 11x15 casserole dish - this makes a LOT of food. Third, I use 6 cups of sauce (I use my own) and use 20oz hot Italian turkey sausage (which I take out of the casings and crumble). Like others have mentioned, I prefer to mix (1 cup) sour cream and (1 cup) cottage cheese and the mozzarella in a bowl and mix the pasta into the sauce (under cook the pasta by 2 minutes). 

Layer pasta/cheese/pasta and top with grated parm and provolone & bake for 20-30 mins at 350. A little work but it makes a ton and is quite tasty!
I might use ricotta instead of cottage cheese.
Easy and delicious!
So good, and so easy. I like that it is not hard to use what I have on hand and it still turns out delish!

Made last night and had to omit the cottage cheese and sour cream as I was out, used ricotta instead and it was great! I did add extra garlic and a dash of Italian seasonings to the meat. The best part was adding fresh Basil from my garden after it was cooked, that totally kicked it up a notch. My family loves this dish. *** I never use store bought pork or beef grounded meats, always organic, venison.***
I made it just as written except I combined the sour cream and cottage cheese before layering it on. Delicious.
I will definitely make this again. Made it for my son & his family & another batch for my husband & myself. Didn't have any cottage cheese so I made it without it. Everyone loved it!
Pretty good, easy meal.....I doctored up a bit.

Sautéed onion, garlic, ground meat/pork, season liberally w/Italian seasoning, onion powder, S and P. Add red sauce. Reserve the remaining half jar or red sauce for later. Add cooked pasta and sour cream/cheese mixture. For sour cream mix, combine the shredded cheeses (reserve a little for later), sour cream and low fat ricotta (instead of cottage cheese). IMPORTANT: Only need about 1/4 of the amount of sour cream mixture called for or will be wayyyyy too rich. Add all to greased pan. Use any combo of cheeses. Top with reserve sauce and additional shredded cheese. Can add a layer of sliced meatballs in the middle of the pasta if desired.
excellent, going to make it for 120 people this weekend!

Loved this ziti. Made a few changes to fit our diet. Didn't add any meat, used wheat ziti and jar pasta sauce. Doubled the cottage cheese and sour cream and layered sauce, ziti, cheese mixture. Baked for an hour with foil over it. Came out awesome. Thank you for the recipe
I have been making this for years everyone loves it. I omitted the pork and rosemary because I have picky eaters in the house.
I've been making this recipe for almost 10 years. It is always a hit.
